name: Occipitofrontalis
action: Rasises the eyebrows

name: Occipitalis
origin: Superior nuchal line of the occipital bone; mastoid part of the temporal bone
action: Moves the scalp back

name: Frontalis
origin: Skin of the eyebrow and Glabella
action: Wrinkles eyebrow

name: Orbicularis oculi
origin: Orbital part: frontal bone. Palpebral part: medial palpebral ligament. Lacrimal part: Posterior crest of lacrimal bone
insertion: Orbital part: lateral palpebral raphe.  Palpebral part: lateral palpebral raphe. Lacrimal part: Edges of eyelids
nerve: Zygomatic branch of facial nerve [CN VII]
action: Closes eyelids

name: Oorrugator supercilii
insertion: Intermediate third of skin of eyebrow
action: Moves skin of forehead medially and inferiorly (towards root of nose)

name: Depressor supercilii
origin: Nasal part of the frontal bone, medial rim of orbit
insertion: Medial third of skin of eyebrow
action: Moves skin of eyebrows inferiorly

name: Levator palpebrae superioris
action: Retracts/elevates eyelid

name: Superior tarsal
insertion: Superior tarsal plate of the eyelid
action: Raise the upper eyelid

name: Rectus muscles
origin: Annulus of Zinn at the orbital apex
action: Superior: Elevates, adducts, and rotates medially the eye. Inferior: depression and adduction. Medial: adducts the eyeball. Lateral: abducts the eyeball.

name: Oblique muscles
origin: Superior: Annulus of Zinn at the orbital apex, medial to optic canal. Inferior: Orbital surface of the maxilla, lateral to the lacrimal groove.
insertion: Superior: Outer posterior quadrant of the eyeball. Inferior: Laterally onto the eyeball, deep to the lateral rectus, by a short flat tendon
artery: Lateral muscular branch of the ophthalmic artery
nerve: Superior: Trochlear nerve [CN IV]. Inferior: Oculomotor nerve [CN III]
action: Superior: Primary: intorsion. secondary:abduct (laterally rotate) and depress the eyeball. Inferior: Extorsion, elevation, abduction.

name: Auricularis posterior
origin: Mastoid process of temporal bone and tendon of sternocleidomastoid

name: Stapedius
action: Control the amplitude of sound waves to the inner ear

name: Tensor tympani
nerve: Medial pterygoid nerve from mandibular nerve [CN V3]
action: Tensing the tympanic membrane

name: Procerus
origin: Fascia over the lower part of the nasal bone
insertion: Skin of the lower part of the forehead between the eyebrows
nerve: Buccal branch of facial nerve [CN VII]
action: Draws down the medial angle of the eyebrow, giving expressions of frowning

name: Depressor septi nasi
insertion: Nasal septum and back part of the alar part of nasalis muscle
nerve: Buccal branch of facial nerve [CN VII]
action: Depression of nasal septum

name: Levator labii superioris alaeque nasi
nerve: Buccal branch of facial nerve [CN VII]
action: Dilates the nostril; elevates the upper lip and wing of the nose

name: Nasalis: compressor naris
origin: Alveolar yoke of the canine tooth
nerve: Buccal branch of facial nerve [CN VII]
action: Compression of nostrils

name: Nasalis: dilator naris
origin: Alveolar yoke of lateral incisor tooth, greater and lesser alar cartilages
insertion: Skin near the margin of the nostril
nerve: Buccal branch of facial nerve [CN VII]
action: Dilation of nostrils

name: Levator anguli oris (caninus)
action: Smile (elevates angle of mouth)

name: Depressor anguli oris (triangularis)
nerve: Mandibular branch of the facial nerve [CNVII]
action: Depresses angle of mouth

name: Levator labii superioris
origin: Medial part of infra-orbital margin of maxilla
insertion: Skin and muscle of the upper lip (labii superioris)
nerve: Buccal branch of the facial nerce [CNVII]
action: Elevates the upper lip

name: Depressor labii inferioris
origin: Oblique line of the mandible, between the symphysis and the mental foramen
insertion: Integument of the lower lip, orbicularis oris fibers, its fellow of the opposite side
action: Depresses the lower lip

name: Mentalis
origin: Alveolar yoke of the lower, lateral incisor tooth, found on the anterior mandible
artery: Inferior labial branch of facial artery
nerve: Mandibular branch of the facial nerve [CNVII]
action: Elevates and wrinkles skin of chin, protrudes lower lip

name: Buccinator
origin: Alveolar processes of the maxilla and mandible, pterygomandibular raphe
nerve: Buccal branch of the facial nerce [CNVII]
action: Compress the cheeks against the teeth (blowing), mastication.

name: Orbicularis oris
nerve: Buccal branch of the facial nerce [CNVII]
action: Puckers the lips

name: Risorius
nerve: Buccal branch of the facial nerce [CNVII]
action: Draw back angle of mouth

name: Zygomatic muscles: major
origin: Zygomatic bone in region of zygomaticomaxillary suture
nerve: Buccal branch of the facial nerce [CNVII]
action: Draws angle of mouth upward and laterally

name: Zygomatic muscles: minor
origin: Zygomatic bone in region of zygomaticomaxillary suture
nerve: Buccal branch of the facial nerce [CNVII]
action: Elevates upper lip

name: Masseter
origin: Anterior two-thirds of inferior margin of the zygomatic arch and maxilla
nerve: Masseteric nerve, from mandibular nerve [CN V3]
action: Elevation (closing the mouth) and retraction of mandible

name: Temporalis
origin: Temporal lines on the parietal bone of the skull
action: Elevation (closing the mouth) and retraction of mandible

name: Lateral pterygoid
origin: Greater wing of sphenoid and lateral pterygoid process
nerve: External pterygoid nerve from the mandibular nerve [CNV3]
action: Depresses mandible

name: Medial pterygoid
origin: Deep head: medial side of lateral pterygoid plate behind the upper teeth. Superficial head: pyramidal process of palatine bone and maxillary tuberosity
nerve: Medial pterygoid nerve from the mandibular nerve [CNV3]
action: Elevates mandible, closes jaw, helps lateral pterygoid muscle in moving the jaw from side to side

name: Genioglossus
origin: Superior part of mental spine of mandible (symphysis menti)
insertion: Dorsum of tongue and body of hyoid
action: Inferior fibers protrude the tongue, middle fibers depress the tongue, and its superior fibers draw the tip back and down

name: Hyoglossus
action: Depresses tongue

name: Chondroglossus
origin: Lesser cornu and body of the hyoid bone
insertion: Intrinsic muscular fibers of the tongue
action: Depresses tongue

name: Styloglossus
action: Elevates and retracts tongue

name: Palatoglossus
nerve: Vagus nerve and cranial accessory nerve
action: Raising the back part of the tongue

name: Superior longitudinal
origin: Close to the epiglottis, from the median fibrous septum
action: Shortens, turns tip upward, turns lateral margins upward

name: Transversus
action: Narrows and not elongated

name: Inferior longitudinal
action: Shortens, retracts, pulls tip downward

name: Verticalis muscle
action: Flattens

name: Levator veli palatini
action: Aids in swallowing by elevating the soft palate

name: Tensor veli palatini
origin: Medial pterygoid plate of the sphenoid bone
action: Aids in swallowing by controlling the tension of the soft palate

name: Musculus uvulae
action: Moves and changes shape of the uvula

name: Palatoglossus
nerve: Vagus nerve and cranial accessory nerve
action: Aids in respiration by raising the back part of the tongue

name: Palatopharyngeus
insertion: Upper border of thyroid cartilage (blends with constrictor fibers)
nerve: Vagus nerve and cranial accessory nerve
action: Aids in respiration by pulling the pharynx and larynx

name: Stylopharyngeus
artery: Pharyngeal branches of ascending pharyngeal artery
action: Elevate the larynx, elevate the pharynx, swallowing

name: Salpingopharyngeus
insertion: Posterior fasciculus of the pharyngopalatinus muscle
nerve: Vagus nerve and cranial accessory nerve
action: Raise the nasopharynx

name: Pharyngeal muscles - Inferior
artery: Pharyngeal branches of ascending pharyngeal artery
nerve: External laryngeal branch of the vagus nerve
action: Swallowing

name: Pharyngeal muscles - Middle
artery: Pharyngeal branches of ascending pharyngeal artery
action: Swallowing

name: Pharyngeal muscles - Superior
origin: Medial pterygoid plate, pterygomandibular raphé, alveolar process
action: Swallowing

name: Cricothyroid
insertion: Inferior cornu and lamina of the thyroid cartilage
nerve: External laryngeal branch of the vagus nerve
action: Tension and elongation of the vocal folds (has minor adductory effect)

name: Arytenoid
nerve: Recurrent laryngeal branch of the vagus nerve
action: Approximate the arytenoid cartilages (close rima glottidis)

name: Thyroarytenoid
origin: Inner surface of the thyroid cartilage (anterior aspect)
nerve: Recurrent laryngeal branch of the vagus nerve
action: Thickens the vocal folds and decreases length; also helps to adduct the vocal folds during speech

name: Cricoarytenoid muscles - Posterior
insertion: Muscular process of the arytenoid cartilage
nerve: Recurrent laryngeal branch of the vagus nerve
action: Abducts and laterally rotates the cartilage, pulling the vocal ligaments away from the midline and forward and so opening the rima glottidis

name: Cricoarytenoid muscles - Lateral
origin: Lateral part of the arch of the cricoid
insertion: Muscular process of the arytenoid cartilage
nerve: Recurrent laryngeal branch of the vagus nerve
action: Adduct and medially rotate the cartilage, pulling the vocal ligaments towards the midline and backwards and so closing off the rima glottidis

name: Platysma
insertion: Inferior clavicle and fascia of chest
artery: Branches of the submental artery and suprascapular artery
nerve: Cervical branch of the facial nerve [CN VII]
action: Tenses the skin of the neck

name: Sternocleidomastoid
origin: Sternal head: manubrium sterni. Clavicular head: medial portion of the clavicle
insertion: Mastoid process of the temporal bone, superior nuchal line
artery: Occipital artery and the superior thyroid artery
nerve: Motor: accessory nerve. Sensory: cervical plexus.
action: Acting alone, tilts head to its own side and rotates it so the face is turned towards the opposite side. Acting together, flexes the neck, raises the sternum and assists in forced inspiration.

name: Digastric
origin: Anterior belly: digastric fossa (mandible). Posterior belly: mastoid process of temporal bone
insertion: Intermediate tendon (lesser horn of hyoid bone)
nerve: Anterior belly: mandibular nerve [CN V3] via the mylohyoid nerve. Posterior belly: facial nerve [CN VII]
action: Opens the jaw when the masseter and the temporalis are relaxed.

name: Stylohyoid
action: Elevate the hyoid during swallowing.

name: Mylohyoid
artery: Mylohyoid branch of inferior alveolar artery
nerve: Mylohyoid nerve, from inferior alveolar branch of mandibular nerve [CN V3]
action: Raises oral cavity floor, elevates hyoid, depresses mandible.

name: Geniohyoid
insertion: Anterior surface of body of hyoid bone
action: Elevates the hyoid and the tongue upward during deglutition.

name: Sternohyoid
action: Depress hyoid bone.

name: Sternothyroid
action: Depresses larynx, may slightly depress hyoid bone.

name: Sternothyroid
action: Depresses larynx, may slightly depress hyoid bone.

name: Thyrohyoid
action: Depress hyoid bone.

name: Omohyoid
action: Depresses the larynx and hyoid bone. Carries hyoid bone backward and to the side.

name: Longus colli
action: Flexes the neck and head.

name: Longus capitis
origin: Anterior tubercles of the transverse processes of C3, C4, C5, C6
insertion: Basilar part of the occipital bone
action: Flexion of neck at atlanto-occipital joint.

name: Rectus capitis anterior
action: Flexion of neck at atlanto-occipital joint.

name: Rectus capitis lateralis
origin: Upper surface of the transverse process of the atlas
insertion: Under surface of the jugular process of the occipital bone
action: Side-flexion at atlanto-occipital joint.

name: Anterior scalene
artery: Ascending cervical artery (branch of inferior thyroid artery)
action: When the neck is fixed, elevates the first rib to aid in breathing or when the rib is fixed, bends the neck forward and sideways and rotates it to the opposite side.

name: Middle scalene
artery: Ascending cervical artery (branch of inferior thyroid artery)
action: Elevate 1st rib, rotate the neck to the opposite side.

name: Posterior scalene
artery: Ascending cervical artery, superficial cervical artery
action: Elevate 2nd rib, tilt the neck to the same side.

name: Levator scapulae
origin: Posterior tubercles of transverse processes of C1 – C4
insertion: Superior part of medial border of scapula
nerve: Cervical nerve (C3, C4) and dorsal scapular nerve (C5)
action: Elevates scapula and tilts its glenoid cavity inferiorly by rotating scapula.

name: Rectus capitis lateralis
origin: Upper surface of the transverse process of the atlas (C1)
insertion: Under surface of the jugular process of the occipital bone

name: Oobliquus capitis superior
insertion: Lateral half of the inferior nuchal line

name: Rectus capitis posterior minor
origin: Tubercle on the posterior arch of the atlas (C1)
insertion: Medial part of the inferior nuchal line of the occipital bone and the surface between it and the foramen magnum
nerve: A branch of the dorsal primary division of the suboccipital nerve
action: Extends the head at the neck, but is now considered to be more of a sensory organ than a muscle

name: Rectus capitis posterior major
insertion: Inferior nucheal line of the occipital bone

name: Semispinalis capitis
origin: Articular processes of C4-C6; transverse processes of C7 and T1-T7
insertion: Occipital bone between the superior and inferior nuchal lines
action: Extension of the head.

name: Longissimus capitis
origin: Articular processes of C4-C7; transverse processes of T1-T5
insertion: Posterior margin of the mastoid process
action: Laterally: Flex the head and neck to the same side. Bilaterally: Extend the vertebral column.

name: Splenius capitis
origin: Ligamentum nuchae, spinous processes of C7-T6
action: Extend, rotate, and laterally flex the head.

name: Obliquus capitis superior
insertion: Lateral half of the inferior nuchal line

name: Iliocostalis - Erector Spinae
origin: On the spines of the last four thoracic vertebrae
insertion: Both the spines of the most cranial thoracic vertebrae and the cervical vertebrae
action: Extends the vertebral column

name: Longissimus - Erector Spinae
origin: Transverse process on the spines of the last four thoracic vertebrae
insertion: Transverse process on both the spines of the most cranial thoracic vertebrae and the cervical vertebrae
action: Extends the vertebral column

name: Spinalis - Erector Spinae
origin: Spinous process on the spines of the last four thoracic vertebrae
insertion: Spinous process on both the spines of the most cranial thoracic vertebrae and the cervical vertebrae
action: Extends the vertebral column

name: Erector Spinae
origin: On the spines of the last four thoracic vertebrae
insertion: On both the spines of the most cranial thoracic vertebrae and the cervical vertebrae
action: Extends the vertebral column

name: Latissimus dorsi
origin: Spinous processes of thoracic T6-T12, thoracolumbar fascia, iliac crest and inferior 3 or 4 ribs
insertion: Floor of intertubercular groove of the humerus
action: Pulls the forelimb dorsally and caudally

name: Transversospinales - semispinalis capitus
origin: Transverse process of lower cervical and higher thoracal columna
insertion: Area between superior and inferior nuchal line
action: Extends the head.

name: Transversospinales - multifidus
origin: Sacrum, erector spinae aponeurosis, PSIS, and iliac crest
action: Stabilizes vertebrae in local movements of vertebral column.

name: Interspinales
action: Extension, flexion and rotation of vertebral column.

name: Intertransversarii
action: Lateral flexion of trunk.

name: Splenius capitis
origin: Ligamentum nuchae, spinous process of C7-T6
insertion: Mastoid process of temporal and occipital bone
action: Extend, rotate, and laterally flex the head.

name: Splenius cervicus
insertion: Transverse processes of C1, C2, C3
action: Extend, rotate, and laterally flex the head.

name: Intercostals - external
action: Inhalation.

name: Intercostals - internal
action: Hold ribs steady.

name: Intercostals - innermost
action: Elevate ribs.

name: Subcostales
insertion: Inner surface of the second or third rib above, near its angle

name: Transversus thoracis
origin: Costal cartilages of last 3–4 ribs, body of sternum, xiphoid process
action: Depresses ribs.

name: Levatores costarum
origin: Transverse processes of C7 to T12 vertebrae
insertion: Superior surfaces of the ribs immediately inferior to the preceding vertebrae
nerve: Dorsal rami – C8, T1, T2, T3, T4, T5, T6, T7, T8, T9, T10, T11
action: Assists in elevation of the thoracic rib cage.

name: Serratus posterior - inferior
insertion: Inferior borders of the 9th through 12th ribs
action: Depress the lower ribs, aiding in expiration.

name: Serratus posterior - superior
origin: Nuchal ligament (or ligamentum nuchae) and the spinous processes of the vertebrae C7-T3
insertion: Upper borders of the 2nd through 5th ribs
action: Depress the lower ribs, aiding in inspiration.

name: Diaphragm
artery: ericardiacophrenic artery, musculophrenic artery, inferior phrenic arteries
action: Inspiration.

name: Transversus abdominis
insertion: Pubic tubercle via the conjoint tendon, also known as the falx inguinalis.
nerve: Intercostal nerves T7, T8, T9, T10, T11, subcostal nerve (T12), iliohypogastric nerve, ilioinguinal nerve, genitofemoral nerve
action: Compress the ribs and viscera, providing thoracic and pelvic stability.

name: Rectus abdominis
insertion: Costal cartilages of ribs 5–7, xiphoid process of sternum.
nerve: Segmentally by thoraco-abdominal nerves (T7, T8, T9, T10, T11, T12)
action: Flexion of trunk/lumbar vertebrae.

name: Pyramidalis
action: Tensing the linea alba.

name: Cremaster
action: Raise and lower the scrotum.

name: Quadratus lumborum
insertion: Last rib and transverse processes of lumbar vertebrae
action: Alone: lateral flexion of vertebral column; Together: depression of thoracic rib cage.

name: External oblique
nerve: Intercostal nerves T5 - T11, subcostal nerve (T12)
action: Rotates torso.

name: Internal oblique
origin: Inguinal ligament, iliac crest and the lumbodorsal fascia
insertion: Linea alba, xiphoid process and the inferior ribs.
nerve: Intercostal nerves T8 - T11, subcostal nerve (T12), iliohypogastric nerve, ilioinguinal nerve
action: Compresses abdomen and rotates vertebral column.

name: Coccygeus
action: Closing in the back part of the outlet of the pelvis.

name: Levator ani - iliococcygeus
origin: Ischial spine and from the posterior part of the tendinous arch of the pelvic fascia.
nerve: levator ani nerve (S4), inferior rectal nerve from pudendal nerve (S3, S4), coccygeal plexus
action: Supports the viscera in pelvic cavity.

name: Levator ani - pubococcygeus
origin: Back of the pubis and from the anterior part of the obturator fascia.
nerve: levator ani nerve (S4), inferior rectal nerve from pudendal nerve (S3, S4), coccygeal plexus
action: Controls urine flow and contracts during orgasm.

name: Levator ani - puborectalis
origin: Lower part of the pubic symphysis.
action: Inhibit defecation.

name: Sphincter ani - externus
nerve: S4 and twigs from inferior anal nerves of pudendal nerve
action: Keep the anal canal and anus closed, aids in the expulsion of the feces

name: Sphincter ani - internus
action: Keep the anal canal and anus closed, aids in the expulsion of the feces

name: Bulbospongiosus
action: Males: empties the urethra. Females: clenches the vagina

name: Ischiocavernosus
action: Males: empties the urethra. Females: clenches the vagina

name: Transversus perinei profundus
insertion: Its fellow of the opposite side

name: Sphincter urethrae membranaceae
origin: Junction of the inferior rami of the pubis and ischium to the extent of 1.25–2 cm., and from the neighboring fasciæ
insertion: Its fellow of the opposite side
nerve: Perineal branch of the pudendal nerve (S2, S3, S4)
action: Constricts urethra, maintain urinary continence.

name: Trapezius
origin: Down the midline, from the external occipital protuberance, the nuchal ligament, the medial part of the superior nuchal line, and the spinous processes of the vertebrae C7-T12
insertion: The lateral third of the clavicle, the acromion process and into the spine of the scapula
nerve: Major nerve supply is the CN XI.
action: Retraction and elevation of scapula.

name: Rhomboid major
origin: Spinous processes of the T2 - T5
insertion: Medial border of the scapula, inferior to the insertion of rhomboid minor muscle
action: Retracts the scapula and rotates it to depress the glenoid cavity. It also fixes the scapula to the thoracic wall.

name: Rhomboid minor
origin: Nuchal ligaments and spinous processes of C7- to T1 vertebrae
insertion: Medial border of the scapula, superior to the insertion of rhomboid major muscle
action: Retracts the scapula and rotates it to depress the glenoid cavity. It also fixes the scapula to the thoracic wall.

name: Pectoralis major
origin: Clavicular head: anterior surface of the medial half of the clavicle. Sternocostal head: anterior surface of the sternum, the superior six costal cartilages
artery: Pectoral branch of the thoracoacromial trunk
nerve: Lateral pectoral nerve and medial pectoral nerve. Clavicular head: C5 and C6. Sternocostal head: C7, C8 and T1.
action: Clavicular head: flexes the humerus. Sternocostal head: extends the humerus. As a whole, adducts and medially rotates the humerus. It also draws the scapula anteriorly and inferiorly.

name: Pectoralis minor
origin: 3rd to 5th ribs, near their costal cartilages
insertion: Medial border and superior surface of the coracoid process of the scapula
artery: Pectoral branch of the thoracoacromial trunk
action: Stabilizes the scapula by drawing it inferiorly and anteriorly against the thoracic wall.

name: Subclavius
action: Depresses the clavicle.

name: Serratus anterior
origin: Fleshy slips from the outer surface of upper 8 or 9 ribs
insertion: Costal aspect of medial margin of the scapula
artery: Lateral thoracic artery (upper part), thoracodorsal artery (lower part)
nerve: Long thoracic nerve (from roots of brachial plexus C5, C6, C7)
action: Protract and stabilize scapula, assists in upward rotation.

name: Deltoid
origin: Clavicle, acromion, spine of the scapula
action: Shoulder abduction, flexion and extension.

name: Teres major
origin: Posterior aspect of the inferior angle of the scapula
insertion: Ledial lip of the intertubercular sulcus of the humerus
nerve: Lower subscapular nerve (segmental levels C5 and C6)
action: Internal rotation of the humerus.

name: Supraspinatus
insertion: Superior facet of greater tubercle of humerus
action: Abduction of arm and stabilizes humerus.

name: Infraspinatus
insertion: Middle facet of greater tubercle of the humerus
action: Lateral rotation of arm & Adduction of arm and stabilizes humerus.

name: Teres minor
insertion: Inferior facet of greater tubercle of the humerus
artery: Posterior circumflex humeral artery and the circumflex scapular artery
action: Laterally rotates and adducts the arm.

name: Subscapularis
nerve: Upper subscapular nerve, lower subscapular nerve (C5, C6)
action: Internally rotates humerus. Stabilises shoulder

name: Coracobrachialis
nerve: Musculocutaneous nerve (Lateral cord: C5, C6, C7)
action: Flexes at shoulder joint

name: Biceps brachii
origin: Short head: coracoid process of the scapula. Long head: supraglenoid tubercle
nerve: Musculocutaneous nerve (Lateral cord: C5, C6, C7)
action: Flexes elbow and supinates forearm

name: Brachialis
origin: Anterior surface of the humerus, particularly the distal half of this bone
insertion: Coronoid process and the tuberosity of the ulna
nerve: Musculocutaneous nerve (Lateral cord: C5, C6, C7)
action: Flexes elbow

name: Triceps brachii
origin: Long head: Infraglenoid tubercle of the scapula. Lateral head: posterior humerus – above radial grove. Medial head: posterior humerus-under radial groove
action: Extends forearm, caput longum adducts shoulder

name: Anconeus
insertion: Lateral surface of the olecranon process and the superior part of the posterior ulna
action: Partly blended in with the triceps, which it assists in extension of the forearm. Stabilises the elbow and abducts the ulna during pronation.

name: Pronator teres
origin: Humeral head: medial epicondyle of humerus (common flexor tendon). Ulnar head: coronoid process of the ulna
action: Pronation of forearm, flexes elbow.

name: Flexor carpi radialis
origin: Medial epicondyle of humerus (common flexor tendon)
insertion: Bases of second and third metacarpal bones
action: Flexion and abduction/radial deviation at wrist.

name: Palmaris longus
origin: Medial epicondyle of humerus (common flexor tendon)
action: Wrist flexor.

name: Flexor carpi ulnaris
origin: Medial epicondyle of humerus (common flexor tendon)
action: Flexion and adduction/ulnar deviation of wrist.

name: Flexor digitorum superficialis
origin: Medial epicondyle of humerus (common flexor tendon), as well as parts of the radius and ulna.
action: Flexor of fingers (primarily at proximal interphalangeal joints).

name: Pronator quadratus
origin: Medial, anterior surface of the ulna.
insertion: Lateral, anterior surface of the radius
action: Pronates the forearm.

name: Flexor digitorum profundus
nerve: Median nerve (anterior interosseous nerve), muscular branches of ulnar nerve
action: Flex hand, interphalangeal joints

name: Flexor pollicis longus
origin: The middle 1/2 of the Volar surface of the radius and the adjacent interosseus membrane.
insertion: The base of the distal phalanx of the thumb
action: Flexion of the thumb.

name: Extensor digitorum
action: Extension of hand and fingers.

name: Extensor digiti minimi
origin: Anterior portion of the lateral epicondyle of the humerus (common extensor tendon)
insertion: Extensor expansion, located at the base of the proximal phalanx of the finger on the dorsal side
artery: Posterior interosseous artery which originates from the common interosseous artery and more proximally, the ulnar artery
action: Extends the little finger at all joints.

name: Extensor carpi ulnaris
action: Extends and adducts/ulnar deviation of the wrist.

name: Brachioradialis
origin: Lateral supracondylar ridge of the humerus.
action: Flexion of forearm.

name: Extensor carpi radialis longus
action: Extensor at the wrist joint, abducts the hand at the wrist.

name: Extensor carpi radialis brevis
origin: Aanterior of lateral epicondyle (common extensor tendon)
action: Extensor and abductor of the hand at the wrist joint.

name: Supinator
origin: Lateral epicondyle of the humerus, supinator crest of ulna, radial collateral ligament, annular ligament
action: Supinates forearm.

name: Extensor indicis
action: Extends index finger, wrist.

name: Abductor pollicis longus
action: Abduction, extension of thumb.

name: Extensor pollicis brevis
action: Extension of thumb at metacarpophalangeal joint.

name: Extensor pollicis longus
action: Extension of thumb at metacarpophalangeal and interphalangeal joint.

name: Opponens pollicis
insertion: Metacarpal bone of the thumb on its radial side
action: Opposition of the thumb.

name: Flexor pollicis brevis
nerve: Median nerve, deep branch of ulnar nerve (medial head).
action: Flexes the thumb.

name: Abductor pollicis brevis
origin: Transverse carpal ligament, the scaphoid and trapezium
insertion: Radial base of proximal phalanx of thumb and the thumb extensors
action: Abducts the thumb.

name: Adductor pollicis
origin: Transverse head: anterior body of the third metacarpal. Oblique head: bases of the second and the third metacarpals and the adjacent trapezoid and capitate bones
insertion: Medial side of the base of the proximal phalanx of the thumb and the ulnar sesamoid
action: Adducts the thumb at the carpometacarpal joint.

name: Palmaris brevis
action: Wrinkle skin of palm.

name: Abductor digiti minimi
insertion: Base of the proximal phalanx of the 5th digit on the ulnar or medial side
nerve: Deep branch of ulnar nerve (C8 and T1)
action: Abduction of 5th digit.

name: Flexor digiti minimi brevis
nerve: Deep branch of ulnar nerve (C8 and T1)
action: Flexion of 5th digit.

name: Opponens digiti minimi
origin: Hook of hamate and flexor retinaculum
nerve: Deep branch of ulnar nerve (C8 and T1)
action: Draws 5th metacarpal anteriorly and rotates it, bringing little finger (5th digit) into opposition with thumb.

name: Lumbricals
artery: Superficial palmar arch, common palmar digital arteries, deep palmar arch, dorsal digital artery
nerve: Deep branch of ulnar nerve, median nerve
action: Flex metacarpophalangeal joints, extend interphalangeal joints.

name: Dorsal interossei
artery: Dorsal metacarpal artery and palmar metacarpal artery
nerve: Deep branch of ulnar nerve, median nerve
action: Abduct fingers.

name: Palmar interossei
nerve: Deep branch of ulnar nerve, median nerve
action: Adduct fingers.

name: Iliopsoas
origin: Iliac fossa (iliacus), sacrum (iliacus), spine (T12, L1, lumbar vertebra, Psoas major), psoas minor
insertion: Femur—lesser trochanter (psoas major/minor), shaft below lesser trochanter (iliacus), tendon of psoas major & femur (iliacus)
artery: Medial femoral circumflex artery, iliolumbar artery
nerve: Femoral nerve, Lumbar nerves L1, L2
action: Flexion of hip (psoas major/minor, iliacus), spine rotation (psoas major/minor).

name: Psoas major
origin: Transverse processes, bodies and discs of T12-L5
nerve: Lumbar plexus via anterior branches of L1, L2, L3
action: Flexes and rotates rotates thigh.

name: Psoas minor
origin: Sides of T11 and L1 and IV discs between
action: Weak trunk flexor

name: Iliacus
artery: Medial femoral circumflex artery, Iliolumbar artery
action: Flexes hip

name: Tensor fasciae latae
origin: Iliac crest, anterior superior iliac spine
artery: Primarily lateral circumflex femoral artery, Superior gluteal artery
action: Thigh – flexion, medial rotation. Trunk stabilization.

name: Gluteus maximus muscle
origin: Gluteal surface of ilium, lumbar fascia, sacrum, sacrotuberous ligament
insertion: Gluteal tuberosity of the femur, iliotibial tract
action: External rotation and extension of the hip joint, supports the extended knee through the iliotibial tract, chief antigravity muscle in sitting.

name: Gluteus medius muscle
origin: Gluteal surface of ilium, under gluteus maximus
action: Abduction of the hip; preventing adduction of the hip. Medial rotation of thigh.

name: Gluteus minimus muscle
origin: Gluteal surface of ilium, under gluteus medius
action: Works in concert with gluteus medius: abduction of the hip; preventing adduction of the hip. Medial rotation of thigh.

name: Piriformis
artery: Inferior gluteal artery, lateral sacral artery, superior gluteal artery
nerve: Nerve to the Piriformis (S1 and S2)
action: Lateral rotation of the thigh.

name: Obturator externus
insertion: Medial aspect of greater trochanter of femur
nerve: Posterior branch of obturator nerve (L3, L4)
action: Adduct thigh, rotate laterally thigh.

name: Obturator internus
insertion: Medial aspect of greater trochanter of femur
nerve: Nerve to obturator internus (L5, S1, S2)
action: Abduct thigh, laterally rotates thigh. Stabilises hip during walking

name: Inferior gemellus
nerve: Nerve to quadratus femoris (L4, L5, S1)
action: Laterally rotates thigh.

name: Superior gemellus
nerve: Nerve to obturator internus (L5, S1, S2)
action: Laterally rotates thigh.

name: Articularis genus
action: Pulling the suprapatellar bursa during extension of the knee.

name: Sartorius
origin: Superior to the anterior superior iliac spine
insertion: Medial side of the upper tibia in the pes anserinus
action: Flexion, lateral rotation and abduction of thigh; flexion and medial rotation of leg.

name: Quadriceps femoris
origin: Combined rectus femoris and vastus muscles
insertion: Patella and tibial tuberosity via the patellar ligament
action: Knee extension.

name: Rectus femoris
origin: Anterior inferior iliac spine and the exterior surface of the bony ridge which forms the iliac portion of the acetabulum
insertion: Patella and tibial tuberosity via the patellar ligament
action: Knee extension; hip flexion.

name: Vastus lateralis
origin: Greater trochanter, Intertrochanteric line, and Linea aspera of the femur
insertion: Patella and tibial tuberosity via the patellar ligament
action: Extends and stabilizes knee.

name: Vastus intermedius
insertion: Patella and tibial tuberosity via the patellar ligament
action: Extends knee.

name: Vastus medialis
insertion: Patella and tibial tuberosity via the patellar ligament
action: Extends and stabilizes knee.

name: Biceps femoris
origin: Long head: tuberosity of the ischium. Short head: linea aspera, femur
insertion: Head of the fibula which articulates with the back of the lateral tibial condyle
artery: Inferior gluteal artery, perforating arteries, popliteal artery
nerve: Long head: medial (tibial) part of sciatic nerve. Short head: lateral (common fibular) part of sciatic nerve
action: Flexes knee joint, laterally rotates leg at knee (when knee is flexed), extends hip joint (long head only).

name: Semitendinosus
nerve: Sciatic nerve (tibial part: L5, S1, S2)
action: Flexes knee joint, extends hip joint, medially rotates leg at knee.

name: Semimembranosus
action: Flexes knee joint, extends hip joint, medially rotates leg at knee.

name: Gracilis
action: Adduction of hip, flexion of hip, medial rotation of knee.

name: Pectineus
action: Adduction of hip, flexion of hip.

name: Adductor brevis
origin: Anterior surface of the inferior pubic ramus
insertion: Lesser trochanter and linea aspera of the femur
action: Adduction of hip.

name: Adductor longus
origin: Pubic body just below the pubic crest
action: Adduction & medial rotation of hip.

name: Adductor magnus
insertion: Femur and adductor tubercle of femur
nerve: Posterior branch of obturator nerve (adductor) and tibial part of sciatic nerve (hamstring)
action: Adduction of hip.

name: Tibialis anterior
insertion: Medial cuneiform and first metatarsal bones of the foot
action: Dorsiflex and invert the foot.

name: Extensor hallucis longus
origin: Middle portion of the fibula on the anterior surface and the interosseous membrane
insertion: Dorsal side of the base of the distal phalanx of the Hallux
action: Extends the big toe and assists in dorsiflexion of the foot at the ankle. Also is a weak invertor.

name: Extensor digitorum longus
origin: Lateral Condyle of tibia and superior ¾ of interosseous membrane
insertion: Middle and distal phalanges of lateral four digits
action: Extension of toes and ankle.

name: Peroneus tertius
origin: Distal anterior surface of the fibula
action: Dorsiflex and evert the foot.

name: Gastrocnemius
origin: Medial and Lateral condyle of the femur
nerve: Tibial nerve from the sciatic, specifically, nerve roots S1 and S2
action: Plantarflexion, flexion of knee (minor).

name: Soleus
origin: Fibula, medial border of tibia (soleal line)
nerve: Tibial nerve, specifically, nerve roots L5–S2
action: Plantarflexion.

name: Plantaris
origin: Lateral supracondylar ridge of femur above lateral head of gastrocnemius
insertion: Achilles (medial side, deep to gastrocnemius tendon)
action: Plantarflexion of foot and knee flexion.

name: Popliteus
origin: Middle facet of the lateral surface of the lateral femoral condyle
insertion: Posterior tibia under the tibial condyles
action: Medial rotation and flexion of knee.

name: Flexor hallucis longus
insertion: Base of distal phalanx of hallux
artery: Peroneal artery (peroneal branch of the posterior tibial artery)
action: Flexes all joints of the hallux, plantarflexion of the ankle joint.

name: Flexor digitorum longus
insertion: Distal phalanges of lateral four digits
action: Flexes all joints of the lateral four digits.

name: Tibialis posterior
action: Inversion of the foot, plantar flexion of the foot at the ankle.

name: Peroneus longus
action: Plantarflexion, eversion.

name: Peroneus longus
action: Plantarflexion, eversion.

name: Extensor digitorum brevis
action: Extends digits 2, 3, and 4.

name: Extensor hallucis brevis
insertion: Base of proximal phalanx of hallux
action: Extends first digit.

name: Dorsal interossei of the foot
nerve: Lateral plantar nerve. All dorsal interossei are innervated by the lateral plantar nerve (S2–3). Those in the fourth interosseous space are innervated by the superficial branch and the other by the deep branch. The first and second dorsal interossei muscles additionally receive innervation from the lateral branch of the deep fibular nerve
action: Abducts toes.

name: Abductor hallucis
origin: Medial process of calcaneus, flexor retinaculum, plantar aponeurosis
insertion: Medial side of base of proximal phalanx of first digit
action: Abducts hallux.

name: Flexor digitorum brevis
origin: Medial process of calcaneus, plantar aponeurosis, intermuscular septa
action: Flexes lateral four toes.

name: Flexor digiti minimi
action: Flex and abduct the fifth toe.

name: Quadratus plantae
action: Assists flexor digitorum longus in flexion of DIP joints.

name: Plantar lumbricals
insertion: Medial aspect of extensor expansion of proximal phalanges of lateral four digits
artery: Lateral plantar artery and plantar arch, and four plantar metatarsal arteries
nerve: Lateral plantar nerve (S1, S2) (lateral three lumbricals) and medial plantar nerve (first lumbrical)
action: Maintain extension of digits at interphalangeal joints.

name: Flexor hallucis brevis
origin: Plantar aspect of the cuneiformis, plantar calcaneocuboid ligament, long plantar ligament
insertion: Medial Head: Medial sesamoid bone of the metatarsophalangeal joint, proximal phalanx of great toe. Lateral head: Lateral sesamoid bone of the metatarsophalangeal joint, proximal phalanx of great toe
action: Flex hallux.

name: Adductor hallucis
origin: Oblique Head: proximal ends of middle 3 metatarsal bones. Transverse Head: MTP ligaments of lateral 3 toes
insertion: Lateral side of base of first phalanx of the 1st toe; sesamoid apparatus
action: Adducts hallux.

name: Flexor digiti minimi brevis
action: Extend and adduct the fifth toe.

name: Plantar interossei muscles
insertion: PThe muscles then continue distally along the foot and insert in the proximal phalanges III-V. The muscles cross the metatarsophalangeal joint of toes 3-5 so the insertions correspond with the origin and there is no crossing between toes.
artery: Plantar artery, and dorsal metatarsal artery
action: Since the intersseous muscles cross on the metatarsophalangeal joint, then they act on that specific joint and cause adduction of toes III, IV, and V. Adduction itself is not of extreme importance to the toes, but these muscles work together with the dorsal interosseous muscles in flexion of the foot. They also work together to strengthen the metatarsal arch..
